column4: Hey guys, I tried to install Portable Virtualbox ( http://www.vbox.me/ ) using Wine and it's taking up some massive file somewhere and I don't know where it is. I'm down to 3 mb of space and I don't know what to do
I'm running Wubi and I installed it to my host directory but there's some huge file it's taking up on my Ubuntu :c
Oh crap I'm down to 2 mb now
Guys, my disk space is going down, I need some help..
You seem to be missing the point here

The portable virtualbox app is a Windows program. It legally cannot contain the VirtualBox code so it downloads it somewhere. The .exe has a download button in it. I click it and boom, my hard drive fills up and there seems to be no files anywhere
I looked at the disk usage analyzer and there was nothing different
if your on windows try cleaning out your %temp% folder
Temp folder has been cleaned several times and is not taking up any space
134 gb, wubi was around 5 gb but only had 100 mb left before this
you want to know whats talking up that 100mb or was it more?
I want to know where the files it downloaded are stored because disk usage analyzer/manual searching has been useless so far
log files, temp files, os updates etc... 100mb would be gone quite quickly
